page.title: 12Wragby_Turnor Arms Hotel
page.content: {The Turnor Arms}is the only hotel in the area.It was a coaching inn during the 19th century, and has been an hotel for as long as people can remember.Today,{it employs 5 people}_a cleaner,2 part_time and 2 full_time staff. During the{winter,}most of the {customers are local,}but in{summer there is{a lot of passing trade}from coaches taking people down to the coast.Saturday and Sunday are the two busiest days.There is{room for 14 {people to stay}at the hotel,and it is usually full during the summer months. The 'Turnors' also caters for weddings and birthdays. An{a la carte menu}of steak,chicken or trout plus starter, sweet and coffee{is available for Â£4.75.}Bar meals are also served and the{local {beer costs 66p a pint.
